titles: The English seamans resolution, or, the loyall subjects undaunted valour: Plainly demonstrating the justness of his cause, incouraging [sic] his friends, to daunt his foes: for king and countrey, in the seas he'l perish, to tame the rebells, and make England flourish. To the tune of, I prethee love turn to me. Or, When this old cap was new.
publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright.,
notes: Place and date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  Foreign relations --  Netherlands --  17th century.
